summary: Diff adds a new print-only ResidentProfilePrintReport component, wires it into ResidentProfilePageâ€™s existing Print action via window.print(), and extends global print CSS with page setup, print-only/screen-only visibility, and document-style header/section styling. Some REQ-1/REQ-3 acceptance criteria cannot be confirmed due to truncation (e.g., discontinued meds section, physician/pharmacy/contact sections, table styling details, and page-break avoidance rules).

missing_requirements.requirement: Render a 'Discontinued Medications' section that shows a table/list of discontinued meds or a 'No discontinued medications' message when empty.
missing_requirements.reason: The print component computes discontinuedMedications, but the provided diff is truncated before showing whether the Discontinued Medications section is actually rendered and how empty-state is handled.

missing_requirements.requirement: Assigned physicians, pharmacy information, and responsible contacts render as document sections (not cards) with label/value formatting similar to the reference.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows helper logic for physicians (getPhysicianName) but the component content is truncated before confirming that assigned physicians, pharmacy, and responsible contacts are rendered as print document sections.

missing_requirements.requirement: Active medications render as a bordered table with column headers and rows styled for print readability (gridlines, compact padding, consistent fonts).
missing_requirements.reason: The component calculates activeMedications, and index.css mentions print styles, but the truncated excerpts do not show the actual medications table markup or the specific table/gridline styling being applied.

missing_requirements.requirement: Table borders and header background render correctly in print (including in browsers that require print color adjustment).
missing_requirements.reason: The shown print CSS includes general print rules and page structure, but the excerpt does not show explicit print color adjustment rules (e.g., print-color-adjust / -webkit-print-color-adjust) or confirm header background rendering behavior.

missing_requirements.requirement: Sections marked to avoid splitting do not break across pages unless explicitly allowed.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows page-level page-break behavior (.print-page page-break-after), but the excerpt does not show any CSS/classes for avoiding section splitting (e.g., break-inside: avoid) on specific sections.
